about-: Jumeirah Village Circle (JVC) is one of the most popular communities in Dubai that boasts a wide range of residential options such as studios, apartments, villas and townhouses. In its southern District, 13 lies the projects of Mulberry Mansions. It is a uniform row of 12 Victorian-style 3-storey townhouses that include four bedrooms. The developer Al Fara’a Properties launched Mulberry Mansions in 2008 and completed it in 2011. It is located next to projects like the Al Waleed Building and the residential complex of Pantheon Boulevard. This area guide offers a detailed look at the properties, amenities and lifestyle in Mulberry Mansions.
in-a-nutshell:
A collection of 12 four-bed townhouses
Offers well-established freehold properties 
Close to Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road (E311)
Close to Dubai International Stadium
At a walking distance of four to six minutes from bus stops
home
NEIGHBOURHOOD
community-overview:
The project of Mulberry Mansions directly faces the tree-lined Qmasha Street, offering a boulevard view to every independently-owned home. These four-bed townhouses are freehold which means they are open for investments to locals as well as ex-pats.
A part of a pet-friendly community
Exclusive three-floor residences with multiple balconies and terraces
Close to a community park and the main road
Residents get quick access to community parks in JVC
Mulberry Mansions welcomes residents to keep pets while offering community facilities like pet-friendly parks and pet stores. There are also a couple of vet clinics in nearby areas.
properties-in:
The most unique feature of properties in Mulberry Mansions is that they are three (G+2) storeys high, which means, they feature two upper floors apart from the ground floor. Since the living space is distributed between three floors, residents enjoy the view of the community from different perspectives at varying heights.
Mulberry Mansions features three-storey townhouses
The ground floor consists of exterior spaces such as a lawn, porch, terrace deck and parking area, while the interior area features a hall, kitchen, powder room, dining room, living room and an en-suite maid’s room. The second floor includes two terraces and two en-suite bedrooms, while the third features two balconies and an additional two en-suite bedrooms.  The sales trend of Mulberry Mansions homes is as follows:
The corner 4-bed townhouses cost up to AED 2.1M 
The price range of townhouses in the middle lie between AED 1.6M and AED 2M
There are five types of Mulberry Mansion floor plans. Unit A is a western corner property that has a few extra amenities such as a huge garden and an outdoor pool. Similarly, the eastern corner property features an outdoor area. The residences on the corner plots are built over an area of approximately 4,968 sq. ft. Since these are the largest properties in Mulberry Mansion, they have relatively higher demand.
transportation-and-parking-spaces:
Mulberry Mansions is conveniently located next to the community’s main road which offers easy connectivity to other districts within the neighbourhood. Other routes for transportation near Mulberry Mansions include the western Mayar Boulevard. These routes provide access to the bus stations located across the southern Dana Road within the community, which are JVC – Westar Vista Apartment 1 bus station and JVC- Prime Business Tower 1 bus station. Both are located a six-minute walk away. The nearest, however, is JVC – Emirates Garden Rose 2 Apartments 1 bus station at a distance of four minutes on foot.
Residents are provided with a private carport with two parking spaces in Mulberry Mansions townhouses. The shaded carport is located at the backside of the property. Guests can park their cars on the paved driveway area that is well-lit with street lights.
Carports are present at the rear side of the townhouses in Mulberry Mansions
AMENITIES, SCHOOLS AND HEALTHCARE
supermarkets-near:
Supermarkets near Mulberry Mansions that are within a two-minute walking distance include Cistys, also known as Cistys Supermarket in Indigo Ville and Holiday Minimart in the Lavender Project. Other retail options for groceries are also close enough for a walk. These include Spinneys, Rubiyan Grocery, West Zone Fresh Supermarket and Jame Jam Supermarket.
Residents can go to Cisty’s Supermarket for grocery shopping
mosques-near: There are three community mosques near Mulberry Mansions but they are located in the northern region. It will take between five to seven minutes to reach. These prayer areas are Masjid JVC close to Mu’allaqat Boulevard, Saleh Mohammed Bin Lahej Mosque near Bijada Boulevard (North) and a mosque that is being built near The Circle Mall. Other mosques are a 12-minute drive away, such as Sports City Mosque, Al Adel Mosque and Masjid Abu Bakr Al Siddiq, also known as Abu Bakr Al Siddiq Mosque.
other-places-of-worship:
The nearest place of worship for Christian residents is Casa de Oración Torre Fuerte Al Khail Road (E44), around 13 minutes away. They can also access other churches near Mulberry Mansions after a drive of 17 minutes. Located at a five-minute interval between each other, these churches are Gatekeepers Weekday Warehouse, Emirates Baptist Church, Fellowship: A Christian Church in Dubai and Dubai Central Seventh-day Adventist Church.
As for temples near Mulberry Mansions, a trip to the closest India Harnath Ke Jama Masjid will take approximately 18 minutes. There are many more temples towards the northern side, such as Automech Gurudwara, Jain Temple Dubai, Shiridi Sai Baba Mandir and Mahamevnawa Buddhist Temple.
schools-near:
There are multiple options for elementary as well as secondary-level students. Some of these schools near Mulberry Mansions include:
JSS International School
American School of Creative Science Al Barsha
Nord Anglia International School Dubai
Options for preschoolers include:
Stepping Stones 
Kids World Nursery JVC
Emirates British Nursery
JSSIS provides one of the leading curriculums (ICSE)
JSS International School takes students for classes starting from Pre-KG to Year 12. They follow the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) curriculum for Pre-KG to KG-2, while ultimately preparing students for the Indian Certificate of Secondary Education (ICSE) curriculum. Nord Anglia International School Dubai in the Al Barsha community follows the British curriculum and caters to over 76 nationalities. With English as the basic language, it is one of the few schools in Dubai that offers lessons in multiple languages such as Arabic, German, French, Mandarin and Spanish.
Mulberry Mansions also offer proximity to a few driving institutes. Individuals can learn to drive from either Drive Dubai Motorcity or Drive Dubai JVC which is just a three-minute walk away. Students pursuing higher education can choose among many options available at the Dubai Knowledge Village. These include the University of Bradford Dubai, Middlesex University Dubai and the University of Wollongong in Dubai (UOWD).
clinics-and-hospitals-near:
You will find a multitude of pharmacies, clinics and hospitals in JVC and the nearby areas. Some of the medical centres in this development include:
Karama Medical Centre
Emirates Hospital Day Surgery & Medical Centre
MedCare Medical Centre
Karama Medical Centre (KMC) is the only hospital near Mulberry Mansions that is located in Jumeirah Village Circle. Their specialised team of doctors includes dentists, paediatricians, gynaecologists, family doctors and general surgeons. For more advanced medical treatments, patients can visit Emirates Hospital Day Surgery & Medical Centre which is accessible in 12 minutes. For basic health care, patients can go to clinics near Mulberry Mansions such as MedCare Medical Centre, Your Health Clinic, and Apex Medical and Dental Clinics.
nearby-areas:
The areas situated in proximity to Mulberry Mansions include:
Dubai Sports City
Jumeirah Village Triangle
Al Barsha South
Dubai Sports City is located precisely to the south and, as its name suggests, it is home to many sports venues. However, the Dubai International Stadium is its highlight. To the east lies Al Barsha South which is the southern sub-community of Al Barsha. Just like JVC, Jumeirah Village Circle is popular for apartments, villas and townhouses. It is strategically located to the west across Al Khail Road (E44) right next to the neighbourhood.
local_cafe
LIFESTYLE
SHOPPING, DINING AND NIGHTLIFE
malls-near:
Shopaholics have a lot to look forward to as many retail destinations are distributed around the area and some are being constructed. However, the easily accessible malls near Mulberry Mansions include:
Al Khail Avenue
The Circle Mall
My City Centre Al Barsha
Enjoy a wide selection of shopping, dining, and activities
Al Khail Avenue is one of the malls being developed by the leading real estate builder called Nakheel. It is based at the eastern edge of Jumeirah Village Triangle (JVT). It is said that once it is ready it will have 350 retail outlets for dining, shopping, entertainment as well as services.
Also an upcoming shopping place, The Circle Mall is going to be the ultimate retail destination for JVC residents. Its site is just a five-minute drive away from Mulberry Mansions. The nearby mall that offers a complete shopping experience is My City Centre Al Barsha. Although not as large as the other popular Dubai malls, My City Centre Al Barsha has a selection of top brands such as:
Skechers
Inglot
Aldo
Skechers boasts a broad collection of athletic footwear. Their categories range from sport, work and performance wear to casual and relaxed-fit shoes. Inglot is a renowned brand for high-quality skincare and makeup products.
restaurants-near:
Many eateries are located within the master community and a few restaurants near Mulberry Mansions are even close enough for a walk. Some of the top restaurants in JVC are Pide Keyfi which has a Turkish variety, Socialicious where you can try ramen, calamari or baked yoghurt, and Pinza which offers healthy options of pizza. The easily accessible eateries include:
Lokmat Baladna
Coop
Desert Wok Restaurant JVC
A five-minute walk towards the east will lead you to Coop and Lokmat Baladna which offer Middle Eastern cuisine. Coop Restaurant is popular for shawarmas and broasted chicken, while diners love to try the grilled chicken and other Lebanese varieties at Lokmat Baladna. There are also a few cafes in JVC but if you want to have coffee and refreshments at urban places then you can go to:
The Kana Café
Filli Café
Circle Café
The Kana Café in Motor City is known for its shisha option, chic ambience and an impressive variety of food. Besides the well-designed indoor area, they have outdoor seating too where people enjoy the alfresco dining experience. If you are in the mood for some ‘lazy cake’ then head over to the Circle Café. Their menu features a vegan section, as well as, a ‘small plates’ section that consists of finger food like halloumi fries, falafel bites and vegetarian rice rolls.
beaches-near:
Since the master community is hardly 10 kilometres away from the western coast, the beaches near Mulberry Mansions are at an agreeable distance of 14 to 20 minutes. Residents can visit JBR Beach which is equipped with many public-accessible amenities like open-air cinemas and outdoor workout machines. Most importantly, there are also locker rooms for keeping belongings safe, as well as, water taps and showers so that beach-goers can wash sand off their feet, footwear and clothing after a joyful dip in the water.
Family favourite JBR Beach
leisure-activities-and-notable-landmarks:
Mulberry Mansions enjoy proximity to landmarks and leisure destinations located on either side of the development. Here are a few noteworthy mentions:
Address Montgomerie
Dubai Autodrome
The Els Club
Places like Dubai Marina Walk, Al Sufouh Palace, Address Montgomerie, and the Faldo and Majlis golf clubs are located towards the western side. Whereas, the eastern region features Dubai Autodrome, Dubai Miracle Garden, Dubai International Stadium and The Els Club.
The Els Club offers a supreme golfing and leisure experience
There are also many night-out attractions in Dubai that offer a perfect way to spend leisure time during the cooler hours of the day. For instance, Dubai Fountain Lake Ride in Downtown Dubai is approximately 22 minutes away and the weekly The Ripe Night Market in Al Barsha Pond Park which takes place at Al Barsha Pond Park in winter, is an 18-minute drive away.
outdoor-activities,-fitness-and-beauty:
Residents enjoy the following recreational facilities:
Community parks
Cycling tracks
One of the perks of living in Mulberry Mansions is the nearness to an abundance of landscaped green areas. A network of community parks and cycling tracks connect the districts across the village circle. Apart from the swimming pools available in JVC apartment buildings, there are none in the community. However, there are many gyms and fitness studios in JVC that are easily accessible to Mulberry Mansions residents. Yoga practitioners can go to Planyoga. For a more comprehensive workout session, you can go to New Life Fitness Gym. Both fitness centres are located in the same district, as well as, in the same project of Prime Business Centre.
Salons and spas in JVC close to Mulberry Mansions include:
Nail Atelier Salon
Better Beauty Salon
Vinca Rosea Ladies Spa
Many top-rated salons are located just a few steps away from homes. Nail Atelier Salon specialises in nail care services that range from manicures and pedicures to nail extensions and nail art. They also provide additional services for lashes and brows, such as eyelash extensions, eyelash lifting and brow tinting.
community-events:
Jumeirah Village Circle (JVC) is a peaceful residential area and there is hardly ever a dull moment there. Welcoming all JVC residents, several activities and events take place in a harmonious way. These involve, for instance, activities for kids such as face painting, treasure hunting and musical performances. Furry Friends Adoption Day offers an opportunity to adopt a shelter animal. There are local craft activities that bring the mums together.
Interestingly, JVC was also considered one of the best spots in the world to witness the longest lunar eclipse to happen in 2018. The developer Nakheel marked the day by organising a free event for the stargazers that involved alfresco camping, refreshments, movie screenings and giveaways between 9:30 pm to 1:30 am.
social-community-groups: If you have pets then you can join a page called Jumeirah Village Circle (JVC) Pet Owners. Other groups on Facebook that let residents keep in touch with their neighbours include Jumeirah Village Circle, Jumeirah Village Circle Community and Jumeirah Village Circle – Residents.
things-to-consider: Mulberry Mansions offer homes with one or two shared walls with neighbouring properties in the project, which results in a lower level of privacy. Therefore, those who like complete privacy may want to check out villa projects in JVC like Nakheel Villas, Marwa Homes, Mirabella, etc.
location_x:
Downtown Dubai is 24 minutes away 
Dubai International Airport is accessible in 28 minutes
Motor City lies to the east across the D61 and E311 intersection

about-:
In the heart of new Dubai, Jumeirah Village Circle (JVC) is a family-oriented residential community consisting of apartments and villas. JVC is further divided into six districts amid landscaped gardens and among these districts, District 16 has set a benchmark for other residential communities in Dubai.
Located 1.8 km off Jumeirah Village Circle, District 16 is a popular spot for experiencing spectacular sunsets. The villa community has gorgeous gardens, water features and other outdoor facilities. The property units of District 16 ensure a family-friendly environment, utmost comfort and convenience to its residents.
in-a-nutshell:
Eco-friendly residential area
Offers 2 and 3-bedroom villas
Offers easy access to major landmarks in Dubai
Each villa comprises a landscaped private garden, a covered parking area and en-suite bathrooms
Plenty of shopping malls, hospitals and educational institutes are nearby
home
NEIGHBOURHOOD
community-overview:
District 16 offers residents a combination of urban living in a village setting. The locality has grabbed the attention of investors and renters as it is going to be the benchmark for family-friendly residential projects in Dubai.
Prominent features of the community include,
The peaceful neighbourhood of Jumeirah Village Circle
Adjacent to Jebel Ali Racecourse
4-minutes away from the parent community
The closeness to Dubai Marina and Jumeirah Lakes Towers makes weekends and holidays memorable.
properties-in:
Most residential properties in District 16 consists of villas. The coverage area of a 2-bedroom villa in District 16 ranges from 2,690 sq. ft. to 2,990 sq. ft.

The sale price of a 2-bedroom villa in District 16 starts from AED 1.9M and goes up to AED 2.5M
The sale price of villas in the locality range from AED 1.9M to AED 2.5M
The tranquil atmosphere of villas in the neighbourhood makes it an ideal location for families looking for a small place with privacy.
TRANSPORTATION AND PARKING SPACES IN DISTRICT 16
For transportation in District 16, residents can avail the metro service via bus. There are many metro stations situated near the locality. Dubai Internet City Metro Station is 14-minutes’s drive away, Mall of the Emirates 12-minutes drive away while Sharaf DG can be accessed in 14 minutes.
Most residential buildings have allocated covered parking space in District 16 for 1 or 2 cars. However, visitors can use the street parking space for their vehicles.
AMENITIES, SCHOOLS AND HEALTHCARE
supermarkets-near: To cater to the retail needs of residents, one can find a handful of supermarkets near District 16. The nearest one, 4 minutes drive away, is Choithrams Manhattan Tower where freshest fruits and vegetable, household items, bakery items are available all the time. The supermarket also deals in online shopping if one is not in a mood to go for grocery. Other supermarkets near locality include Blue Mart and All Day.
mosques-near: There are several mosques near the sub-community. Saleh Mohammad Bin Lahej Mosque is the nearest one, only 5-minutes drive away. Other mosques near District 16 includes Sports City Mosque, 10-minutes drive away while Khalfan Bin Shanaf can be accessed in 11-minutes’ drive.
other-places-of-worship:
Christian residents can find a few churches near District 16 where they can perform their daily prayers and rituals. The nearest one is Casa de Oracian Torre Fuerte, only 11-minutes drive away. Other churches include Emirates Baptist Church, positioned 15 minutes away and United Christian Church, 18 minutes drive away from the neighbourhood.
The temples near District 16 are a little far away from the locality. Both the temples – Shiva Temple and Shirdi Sai Baba Mandir are around 30 minutes away from the community.
SCHOOLS NEAR DISTRICT 16
The popular nursery options near District 16 are:
Kids World Nursery JVC
Stepping Stones Nurseries and Preschools
Jumeirah International Nursery
A few of the well-known schools near District 16 include:
Global Indian International School
JSS International School
American School of Creative Science
The unique educational approach at Global Indian International School emphasizes on creating a learning experience for students rather than following the curriculum only. The institute can be accessed in 10 minutes via Hessa Street. Located 9-minutes’ drive away, American School of Creative Science provides the best of American and UAE National Curriculum for different subjects including Islamic Studies and Arabic. At a walking distance from the neighbourhood, one can find JSS International School which offers to learn through colourful and interesting activities.
There is an abundance of higher educational institutes near District 16. Popular colleges around the neighbourhood include Dubai College, 12-minutes’ drive away, Brighton College, 9-minute drive away while Cambridge College International can be accessed in 14 minutes.
The famous university campuses nearby include the Abu Dhabi University, Middlesex University and the University of Wollongong. With over 40 graduate and postgraduate programs, Abu Dhabi University is one of its kind in the region. Located at 15-minutes away from District 16, the university campus has been providing quality education to students for the past 16 years.
clinics-and-hospitals-near:
For any sort of medical assistance, residents can visit any of these hospitals near District 16:
Mediclinic Meadows
Karama Medical Centre
Al Zahra Hospital
Located at 15-minutes drive away, Mediclinic Meadows has over 1000 doctors with specialists in paediatrics, gynaecology, ENT and many more. With more than 18 departments, Karama Medical Centre offers an extensive range of treatments to their patients. From general dentistry to physiotherapy and ultrasonography, Karama Medical has experienced staff and the latest equipment. Other clinics near District 16 are My Health Clinic, 11-minutes away while Aster Clinic is 14-minutes’ drive away.
nearby-areas:
Popular residential areas near District 16 are:
District 11
Fortunato
The Manhattan
These residential areas are comprised of apartments and townhouses perfect for couples and small families. Al Khalil Road offers easy access to Jumeirah Village Triangle on the western side and Dubai Motor City on the eastern side of the locality.
Popular entertainment spots nearby include:
Jebel Ali Racecourse
The Els Club
JBR Open Beach
There are ample entertainment destinations available nearby the locality. To enjoy horse racing, drive 10-minutes to the west to reach Jebel Ali Racecourse. The golf match can be enjoyed at fullest in Els Club, 14-minutes away via Al Khalil Road. If you are planning a family picnic at a beach, JBR Open Beach will be an ideal and nearest spot, 18-minutes away from the neighbourhood.
local_cafe
LIFESTYLE
SHOPPING, DINING AND NIGHTLIFE
MALLS NEAR DISTRICT 16
Circle Mall is set to becoming the first shopping destination in the heart of Jumeirah Village Circle launching in the mid of this year. The mall will serve residents of JVC and surrounding neighbourhoods.
At the moment, a few of the popular shopping malls near District 16 are:
City Centre Me’aisem
My City Centre Al Barsha
The Springs Souk
Located at a 13-minutes drive away in the Me’aisem area of Dubai Production City, City Centre Me’aisem is a community-oriented shopping mall. With a wide range of popular shopping and dining options, the mall caters to the needs of the community. City Centre Me’aisem is anchored by a number of international brands including H&M, Carrefour Hypermarket, Sun and Sand Sports, Max Stores and Magic Planet family entertainment centre. My City Centre Al Barsha is located just a minute away from City Centre Me’aisem while The Springs Souk can be accessed in 13-minutes’ drive away.
restaurants-near:
Residents can choose from these options in The Springs Souk:
London Dairy Cafe
Subway
The Coffee Club
Xenia
Yoghurtland
Russo’s
Popular options for restaurants near District 16 are:
Coop Restaurant
Chamina Restaurant
Khaana Badosh
Coop Restaurant is famous for shawarmas. Rocket Chicken Shawarma, Chicken Shawarma Pie, 1 KG Chicken Shawarma are the bestseller of the restaurant. One can reach the restaurant in 8-minutes if driving via Mu’allaqat Boulevard. Other famous restaurants include Chamina Restaurant, 9-minute drive away and Khaana Badosh, a 12-minutes drive away.
The late-night entertainment options in Dubai are limitless. From nightclubs to pubs, one can enjoy the nightlife in the city at fullest. The draught and bottled beers at Crown & Lion Bar is the first choice of customers. Located at 13-minute away, the bar also offers a wide range of fast food including chicken tenders, curly fries and onion rings. The tequila shots of Crystal Bar and ‘hoppetizers’ of The Belgium Beer Cafe are famous in the town. Crystal Bar and Belgian Beer Cafe can be accessed in 13-minutes’ drive.
beaches-near:
Dubai is home to many beaches, one can go for a family picnic or take a break after a long week at work. JBR, JBR Marina Beach and Jumeirah Open Beach are a few of the popular beaches near District 16.
JBR Open Beach is a perfect place for a family picnic. It offers camel riding, banana boating, water sports and several other activities that you can enjoy with your friends and family. JBR Marina can be accessed in 19-minutes drive while JBR is a 21-minute drive away from the neighbourhood.
A handful of water parks are also available near the locality. Aquaventure, Dubai Aqua Park and Splash ‘n’ Party are a few of them.
leisure-activities-and-notable-landmarks:
The notable landmarks near District 16 are:
The Els Club
Address Montgomerie
The Els Club is known for its relaxing environment. It has a wide range of retail and dining options and is just 11-minute drive away. Address Montgomerie can be accessed via Hessa Street in 19-minutes and is famous for its luxurious golfing field.
outdoor-activities,-fitness-and-beauty:
Residents can stay active and fit at:
Jogging tracks in the community park
Swimming pool
Other than that, there are a handful of gyms nearby for fitness lovers, these include Prime Fitness JVC, New Life Fitness Gym and The Warehouse Gym. Located at a walking distance from District 16, Prime Fitness JVC provides the best equipment and professional trainers that make you healthy, happy and unstoppable. The friendly environment and latest techniques adopted by trainers of New Life Fitness Gym motivate members. New Life Fitness is an 8-minutes drive away from the community.
A few of the beauty salons and spas near District 16 are,
Spirals Beauty
The One Gents Salon
Dial A Nail
BerryCut Beauty Salon
Spirals Beauty – 8 minutes of drive from the community has stylists from the UK with experience of more than 20 years. These experts provide you with consultations and offer the best facial, manicure and pedicure.
Grooming salons for men are also available near District 16. The One Gents Salon is 11-minutes’ drive away from the neighbourhood, it offers haircut by expert barbers at a reasonable price. Dial A Nail and BerryCut Beauty Salon are 5 minutes away from the locality.
community-events:
6 races are held per afternoon with 30 minutes of the interval at Jebel Ali Racecourse. The ample parking space allows residents to come and enjoy without being worried about parking hassle. With seating space of approximately 2000 people, Jebel Ali Racecourse is known for a garden party like atmosphere.
Different sporting events held on a monthly basis at The Seven’s Stadium. In June, the stadium is going to host ‘The Dubai Desert Road Run’ on 7th June 2019.
social-community-groups:
Members of the District 16 Jumeirah Village Circle community can keep in touch with other residents through dedicated Facebook groups. A few of those groups are Jumeirah Village Circle District 16 Villas, Jumeirah Village Circle – Residents and Jumeirah Village Circle Community.
THINGS TO CONSIDER
Till the end of 2019, thousands of new residential units are expected to be completed in Dubai and JVC’s District 16 will be one of them. The popularity of the community among the masses has elevated the property prices which may be burdensome for the investor at the moment. After the completion of ongoing projects around the locality, it will definitely pay them off.

Dubai International Airport is 25 minutes’ drive away via Al Khalil Road
16-minute drive to Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina
Safa Park can be accessed via Shaikh Zayed Road in 19 minutes
Adjacent to Jebel Ali Racecourse

about-:
Marina Quays in Dubai Marina is a multi-building complex comprising three individual residential towers Marina Quays, East Tower, Marina Quays, West Tower and Marina Quays, North Tower. Of the three towers, Marina Quays, East Tower is an 11-storey residential building.
About Marina Quays, East Tower, it offers 1, 2 and 3-bedroom apartment units. It was developed by EMAAR Properties. This building shares its podium with the other two towers of the complex. It is also popularly called Marina Quays East.
Dubai Marina is one of the most sought-after areas in Dubai due to the waterfront living experience it offers. Currently, this neighbourhood has over 200 residential buildings.
in-a-nutshell:
Type of building: Residential
Location: Dubai Marina
Developer: Emaar Properties
Date of completion: 2007
Number of floors: 11
Unit type: 1, 2 and 3-bedroom apartment
Type of ownership: Freehold
Amenities: Gym, swimming pool and event space
business
BUILDING DETAILS
Facilities in Marina Quays, East Tower
PARKING
For parking in Marina Quays East Tower, dubai, there are dedicated parking spaces for every unit.
ELEVATORS
There are high-speed elevators in Marina Quays, East Tower.
SECURITY, CENTRAL AIR CONDITIONING AND MAINTENANCE SERVICES
Marina Quays East Tower has 24-hour security and CCTV monitoring. EMAAR provides district cooling service, and utilities are provided by DEWA.
EVENT SPACE
Marina Quays East Tower, dubai has a meeting room and multi-purpose room which can be used to host meetings and recreational activities.
GYM AND FITNESS FACILITIES
Residents have convenient access to a well-equipped gym in Marina Quays, East Tower along with a shared swimming pool.
LIFESTYLE AMENITIES
Lifestyle amenities in Marina Quays East include a professional health club and a mini theatre.
CONCIERGE & GUEST SERVICES
24-hour concierge and guest service is available in Marina Quays, East Tower, with a fully functional help desk in the lobby for immediate assistance.
PET FRIENDLY
Pets are not allowed in Marina Quays, East Tower.
SAFETY FEATURES
This building features the latest fire-fighting equipment and an intercom facility.
Marina Quays East Tower Floor Plans
Bayut has worked on creating a simple format for 2D and 3D floor plans on the website. You can easily find the unit type and bed type you’re interested in by browsing Marina Quays floor plans.

about-:
Hyati Avenue is a 6-storey residential building in Jumeirah Village Circle. The tower is developed by Aurora Real Estate Development and Al Rimal Development Limited and architectural design was done by LACASA Architects & Engineering. Hyati Avenue was launched in 2017 and completed in 2020.
The 6-storey tower offers studio, 1 and 2-bedroom apartments with townhouses. Hyati Avenue features basement parking with numerous facilities such as an outdoor swimming pool, a kid’s play area and a furnished gymnasium. The tower also offers lush landscape with a 24-hour security system.
The residential building is located in District 14 JVC and close to Dana Road and Bijada Bouvelard Street. Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road (E311) is also situated in close proximity to Hyati Avenue.
Street view of Hyati Avenue
Jumeirah Village Circle is a family-friendly neighbourhood in Dubai. Developed by Nakheel, the freehold community offers numerous residential and commercial developments. JVC is also well-connected to the public transportation system of Dubai.

about-:
Park Island, Dubai Marina is a four-tower apartment complex in the waterfront community of Dubai Marina. Developed by Emaar Properties, the four towers are known as Blakely, Fairfield, Bonaire and Sanibel. Blakely and Fairfield have 24 floors, while Bonaire and Sanibel have 28 floors.
The complex offers a total of 556 apartments in 1 and 2-bedroom configurations. These flats have balconies offering breathtaking views of the stunning Marina.
Street views outside the towers
Dubai Marina residents enjoy quick access to the Dubai Marina Walk by Emaar. World-class hotels, restaurants and cafes surround the complex. The Dubai Mall is a 19-minute drive from Park Island, Dubai Marina while The Walk JBR is a 9-minute drive from the apartment complex.
in-a-nutshell:
Type of building: Residential
Location: Dubai Marina
Developer: Emaar Properties
Number of units: 556
Unit type: 1 and 2-bedroom apartments
Type of Ownership: Freehold
Amenities: Gym, swimming pool, squash court, sauna and jacuzzi
business
BUILDING DETAILS
Facilities in Park Island, Dubai Marina
PARKING
4 levels are dedicated to parking in Park Island, Dubai Marina. Each apartment gets at least one parking spot. Guests and visitors have to rely on paid parking spaces in Dubai Marina.
ELEVATORS
There are high-speed elevators in Park Island, Dubai Marina.
SECURITY, CENTRAL AIR-CONDITIONING AND MAINTENANCE SERVICES 
The security staff is available 24 hours. The maintenance staff keeps the complex in pristine condition. Emaar’s own plant provides district cooling services to the complex.
GYM AND FITNESS FACILITIES 
Park Island Marina has a gym and health centre. These residential towers have swimming pools, squash courts, sauna, steam rooms and a jacuzzi. There are separate swimming pools for kids in the complex as well.
LIFESTYLE AMENITIES
There are plenty of lifestyle amenities within the towers. Kids can enjoy their time in the outdoor and indoor play areas. In terms of sports facilities, the towers have billiards and table tennis rooms along with two squash courts.
CONCIERGE AND GUEST SERVICES 
Park Island has 24-hour concierge and guest services.

about-:
Marina Promenade – a project of Emaar Properties group – consists of six buildings situated in Dubai Marina. With the start of their construction in 2005, the stature of these buildings varies from 250 ft. to 480 ft. The complex was completed in the year 2008. The shortest building out of the six has a total of 23 floors while the tallest is a 39-floor tower. The buildings consist primarily of residential units with 1, 2 and 3 bedrooms. Their individual names are Shemara, Attessa, Paloma, Beauport, Aurora and Delphine.
One unique feature about these buildings is that they are connected through a podium that is beautifully landscaped and connects with the Marina Walkway. Marina Promenade by Emaar is situated in the heart of Dubai Marina and it directly faces the creek. The creek offers upfront and close view of the various maritime activities taking place along the harbour. A major road linking with these buildings is the King Salman Bin Abdulaziz Al Saud Street.
in-a-nutshell:
Located in Dubai Marina
Developed by Emaar Properties
Construction began in 2005 and was completed in 2008
A complex of six buildings
1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments are available
Heights of the towers range from 94 metres to 159 metres
Aurora Tower is the shortest tower in the complex with 23 floors
Paloma Tower is the tallest tower in the complex with 39 floors
Availability of kids’ play area, BBQ area and library
Close to King Salman Bin Abdulaziz Al Saud
A street view of Marina Promenade
business
BUILDING DETAILS
Facilities in Marina Promenade
PARKING
Residents will be provided with dedicated, covered parking spots. Visitors can also find a spot to park their vehicle in any nearby parking lot. There are various paid-parking spots spread across the Dubai Marina Area that visitors can utilize. The closest paid-parking to Marina Promenade is the Green Parking – Bahar Car Park, which is a 7-minute walk from Marina Promenade.
ELEVATORS
There are several high-speed elevators in Marina Promenade.
SECURITY, CENTRAL AIR-CONDITIONING AND MAINTENANCE SERVICES 
Along with 24-hour on-site maintenance, there is also round-the-clock security with CCTV surveillance and key-card access control. Emaar offers district cooling to all its projects.
EVENT SPACE
There is a high-end lobby in the complex and a BBQ area where residents can arrange friends and family get-to-gathers.
GYM AND FITNESS FACILITIES 
Residents can access a fitted gym, swimming pools and sauna. There are four swimming pools in the building in total, two of which are dedicated to children and two are for adults.
LIFESTYLE AMENITIES
There is a variety of indoor sports that residents can enjoy within the premises of the complex. There are squash courts, badminton courts, a billiards room and an indoor children’s play area as well. There is also an outdoor children’s play area, a BBQ area and a library.
CONCIERGE AND GUEST SERVICES 
The building also has 24 hours concierge services. These professionals are always on standby to offer assistance for guests and residents – whenever they may need it.
PET-FRIENDLY
Marina Promenade does not allow pets.
Marina Promenade Floor Plans
Bayut has worked on creating a simple format for 2D and 3D floor plans on the website. Residents and investors can find the unit and bed types by browsing Marina Promenade floor plans.

Apartment Types in Marina Promenade
All the six towers; Shemara Tower, Attessa Tower, Paloma Tower, Beauport Tower, Aurora Tower and Delphine Tower have 1, 2 and 3-bed residential units.
1-BEDROOM APARTMENTS IN MARINA PROMENADE 
The typical 1-bed apartment will have 2-baths with a range of 953 sq. ft. to 1,442 sq. ft. of floor space. The unit comes with integrated wardrobes and the living area comes with floor to ceiling windows which allow maximum sunlight into the unit.
2-BEDROOM APARTMENTS IN MARINA PROMENADE
Those looking into something more spacious can consider a 2-bed flat in Marina Promenade that will come with an area limit of 1,410 sq. ft. to 1,664 sq. ft. Some flats in this class will come with a view of the marina. Units may have three bathrooms, a walk-in shower and high-end sanitary ware. The living and dining area have floor to ceiling windows for maximum daylight output. The kitchen area is separate and has integrated kitchen appliances.
3-BEDROOM APARTMENTS IN MARINA PROMENADE
The largest residential unit in Marina Promenade comes with 3-beds. Residents could expect to enjoy a living space of 1,858 sq. ft. to 2,200 sq. ft. and 2 to 4 bathrooms. Additionally, some units will come with a dedicated maid’s room. Similar to other units, residents will enjoy floor to ceiling windows in the living area. There’s also a balcony with a sliding glass door, which makes for most breath-taking views of the harbour and the skyline of Dubai Marina.

NEARBY AMENITIES
Transportation near Marina Promenade
Street view near Marina Promenade
BUS STOPS NEAR MARINA PROMENADE
The nearest bus stops that residents can access is Marsa Dubai, Jumeirah Beach Residence Station 2 bus stop at a distance of 3 minutes and Jumeirah Beach Residence Station 1 bus stop at a distance of 4 minutes.
METRO STATIONS NEAR MARINA PROMENADE
Residents can use DAMAC Metro Station for daily commute as it is just 9 minutes away. Other nearby metro stations include DMCC Metro Station and Ibn Battuta Metro Station at a distance of 10 minutes and 11 minutes, respectively.
TRAM STATIONS NEAR MARINA PROMENADE
There are several tram stations that are reachable within a drive of 5 minutes to 10 minutes. Jumeirah Beach Residence tram station is just 4 minutes away and it is the nearest one for Marina Promenade. Dubai Marina tram station is reachable within 8 minutes of driving.
supermarkets-near:
Supermarkets in the area include:
Al Maya supermarket
Daily Gourmet
West-zone Fresh Supermarket
There are several supermarkets surrounding the community, the closest one is the Al Maya Supermarket, which is just 1-minute away on foot. Here, residents can quickly procure all the necessities needed for daily living. Other nearby supermarkets include Daily Gourmet which is an 11-minute drive east of the towers. Apart from that, there is the West-zone Fresh supermarket, fresh wall supermarket and Waitrose that specializes in selling items imported from Britain.
Nearby Buildings
Nearby buildings include:
Marina Towers
The Torch Apartments
Aurora Tower Dubai
Marina Towers and The Torch Apartments are two of the many residential buildings in the neighbourhood. Marina Towers is just a 3-minute drive away whereas The Torch Apartments is an 8-minutes drive away from the complex.
Major Landmarks
A view of Dubai Marina Walk
Nearby landmarks include:
Dubai Marina Walk
Mall of the Emirates
Bluewaters by Meraas
The Dubai Marina Walk is a 7-km long walkway that is dotted with retail outlets and restaurants. Located just at a distance of 12 minutes, this waterfront walkway also serves as a cycling and jogging track. One of the most celebrated attractions in the area is Bluewaters by Meraas, a one-stop destination with an array of dining and leisure options. It is located just 13 minutes away. Mall of the Emirates is also a renowned attraction for shopping and other activities and it only takes a 17-minute drive to reach it.
restaurants-near:
Popular restaurants in Dubai Marina near Marina Promenade:
Cheesecake Factory
P.F. Changs
Mom’s Food
Being one of the most dynamic neighbourhoods in Dubai, the Marina Promenade has plenty of highly-rated eateries at walking distance. For instance, the Cheesecake Factory (a popular American chain) is an 11-minute walk away. Right next to the Cheesecake Factory is the P.F. Changs that serves some of the most interesting Chinese dishes in Dubai Marina. Mom’s Food is also a renown casual dining option in the neighbourhood that offers a number of Lebanese dishes. It takes only 8 minutes of driving to reach this restaurant.
Fine-dining restaurants near Marina Promenade:
Amaseena – The Ritz-Carlton Dubai
Atelier M
Celebrities
There are numerous fine-dining options near the complex that one can check out. Amaseena – The Ritz-Carlton Dubai, for instance, is situated just 5 minutes drive away from the building and it is a top-tier fine-dining restaurant that serves a menu focused on Arab, Lebanese and Mediterranean cuisines. Atelier M in Pier 7 is also accessible within 8 minutes of driving. It offers French food in a large variety. Celebrities is also a popular fine-dining option located within a 13-minute of driving.
things-to-consider: Marina Promenade offers great value for money – whether one chooses to buy or rent. The only thing to be concerned about is the pet-policy, this is because residents are not allowed to have pets anywhere in Marina Promenade. Apart from this, there is no dedicated parking for visitors, but this hurdle can be tackled by parking in one of the many paid-parking lots surrounding Dubai Marina.

about-: An emerging neighbourhood, Jumeirah Village Circle (JVC) is a freehold master community developed by Nakheel Properties. It is composed of ten districts that are homogeneously arranged in a radial pattern. These districts are numbered from 10 to 19. District 14 lies in the southwestern region of JVC between Lazuward and Bijada Boulevard. It is also close to the Al Khail Road (E44) and Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road (E311) intersection. District 14 features a combination of established and under-construction housing projects. Complemented by modern amenities, these residential units are distributed between villas, townhouses and apartment buildings.
in-a-nutshell:
Property mix of residential plots, serviced apartments, townhouses and flats
Home to the FIVE Jumeirah Village Dubai and The One skyscrapers
A freehold project by Nakheel Properties
Allows easy access to Al Khail Road (E44)
One of the 10 sub-communities in JVC
home
NEIGHBOURHOOD
community-overview:
Like the entire master community, District 14 is a family-centric sub-area offering an urban lifestyle away from the metropolitan commotion. These are the main features of District 14:
Five-star hospitality projects
A mix of villas and apartments
Many parks and recreational amenities
While it is predominantly residential, there are a few commercial and hospitality projects in this sub-community. These are two skyscrapers outshining other projects in the area. The rest of the buildings vary between low and mid-rises. The central plots are primarily dedicated to recreational facilities.
Popular points of interest include:
Communal swimming pools
Tennis and basketball courts for residents
Fitness centres within the greater community
JVC Club – features pool, sports and dining facility
Circle Mall – A community shopping mall for JVC residents
Around 33 communal parks are located in JVC where residents can go strolling, jogging or play outdoor sports like football or cricket.
A district with retail shops, educational institutes and health clinics
properties-in:
As the sub-community is developing, you will find several residential plots for sale in District 14. Districts 10, 11, 12, 13, 15 and 16 are some other clusters where interested investors can buy plots in JVC. Besides, District 14 has a nice blend of townhomes, villas and apartments in various configurations and layouts. Since there are a few hospitality projects, you will also find several hotel suites and serviced apartments. Buying a residential building in District 14 is also a good investment opportunity. Also, one will find hotel apartments for sale in District 14.
RENTAL TRENDS IN DISTRICT 14
Rents in JVC District 14 would vary based on the property and unit type. Some newly constructed units cost higher than others. There’s also a choice of furnished units with relatively higher rents than the unfurnished ones. Those looking to move in quickly can consider those.

transportation-and-parking-spaces:

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION NEAR DISTRICT 14

The J01 bus line passes through these stations.

community-events: Events held at JVC complete the sense of community. They give residents a live social platform to interact with their neighbours in a fun and safe environment. So far, JVC residents have witnessed a number of events and activities such as Pet Adoption Day and JVC Spring Festival.

Factors that make District 14 a popular sub-area are community facilities, road infrastructure and easy access to the main road. However, the ongoing construction in the area can be inconvenient to those specifically living right next to the site. Nevertheless, District 14 is set to provide a self-contained environment to its residents once the community reaches its completion stage.

District 14 is one of the precincts of Jumeirah Village Circle, JVC in Dubai.

about-: Dubai Digital Park (DDP) is a mixed-use development in Dubai Silicon Oasis (DSO), offering a modern lifestyle to residents, workers and visitors. It is the first integrated smart city of the emirate spread over 150,000 sq. m. featuring a comprehensive range of 60 smart services. The neighbourhood is home to regional offices and headquarters of multinational companies, including Giesecke+Devrient (G+D), Ricoh Group and Finsa. It is situated close to Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road (E311) and Al Ain – Dubai Road (E66), providing ease.
in-a-nutshell:
A mixed-use community in Dubai Silicon Oasis
Residential and commercial properties are equipped with smart technologies
Features a hotel, conference centre, central square and a fitness centre
Amenities nearby include schools, supermarkets and healthcare facilities
Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road lie in proximity to the community
home
NEIGHBOURHOOD
community-overview:
Dubai Digital Park Master Plan (Image Credits: Dubai Silicon Oasis Authority)
Dubai Digital Park, formerly known as Silicon Park, is a lifestyle destination in the emirate of Dubai. It spans an area of 150,000 sq. m. situated in the heart of Dubai Silicon Oasis (DSO). Digital Park is a part of a self-sufficient community offering all the basic amenities and facilities families look for. It consists of:
Apartment buildings
8 signature boutique buildings
Plug and Play offices
Radisson Red Hotel 
A conference centre
Retail area and a central square
Dubai Technology Entrepreneur Centre (Dtec)
Fitness and recreational facilities
The apartment buildings are spread over an area of 46,000 sq. m. featuring 235 studio, 1 and 2-bedroom flats. The leasable retail space in the community covers an area of 25,000 sq. m. There are around 85 retail units with shaded and air-conditioned terraces. The 5,000 sq. m. of open space can accommodate 4,400 people with ample parking space and smart traffic management.
Those interested in commercial spaces can opt to choose from the eight signature boutique buildings overlooking the lake or choose from Plug and Play offices located in the central section of the community. The famous Radisson Red Hotel in Dubai Digital Park features 112 rooms and suites and 59 apartments with amenities such as a rooftop bar and pool, a fitness centre and an event space. Dubai Technology Entrepreneur Centre (Dtec) is a creative co-working space in Digital Park offering seed-stage funding, incubator programs and everything you need to set up your business.
properties-in:
The apartment buildings offer studio, 1 and 2-bedroom units
Properties in Dubai Digital Park include apartments, shops and offices. Apartments in the community are available in studio, 1 and 2-bedroom configurations equipped with smart home automation and sensors covering every aspect of water, electrical analysis, air quality and natural emergency sensors.
Fitted and shell and core offices in Digital Park are meticulously designed, creating a superior work environment. The standalone buildings cover an area of 1,200 sq. m. featuring smart services like CCTV and access control, digital signage and parking management. These signature boutiques are suitable for companies planning to set up their headquarters in the heart of Dubai Silicon Oasis. The neighbourhood also offers Plug and Play offices which are ready offices that companies can move into. These furnished offices come with an area ranging between 50 sq. m. to 10,000 sq. m. The floor-to-ceiling glass windows and ample parking spaces are other features of these commercial spaces.
RENTAL TRENDS IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
The rental range of offices in the community is as follows:
The annual rent for offices in Dubai Digital Park ranges between AED 280k to AED 10.3M
The price range of offices depends on the coverage area and amenities offered. The fitted and furnished office spaces usually come with a higher price range, while shell and core and shared spaces have a more affordable rental price.
HOTELS IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Radisson Red Hotel features well-equipped rooms and suites
Radisson Red Hotel is a 4-star hotel in Dubai Digital Park featuring contemporary and chic interiors. It has three buildings; a hotel with 112 rooms, hotel apartments with 59 flats and a business centre. All the rooms are equipped with modern amenities and facilities such as rain showers, free, fast Wi-Fi, in-room safe and coffee and tea facilities.
Guests can enjoy their favourite meal from OUIBAR + Terrace or grab some nutritious sandwiches and salads from RED Roof while lying on lounge chairs near the pool. The hotel also has a Californian seafood restaurant, Cali-Poke serving dishes made with Salmon and Ahi Tuna. Radisson Red Hotel also features multifunctional indoor and outdoor event space to accommodate 700 guests. Other services at the hotel include a fitness centre and an outdoor pool.
TRANSPORTATION AND PARKING SPACES IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Parking spaces in the community
There are ample parking spaces in Dubai Digital Park for residents and office workers alike. Around 2,000 basement parking spaces are available, along with large overflow car parks, which can be used if the basement parking is full. The neighbourhood has smart traffic management that ensures smooth traffic flow. The electric charging points in the community for smart cars are a plus for residents with electric vehicles.
PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Getting around the community is convenient by car. The well-connected street network connects you with the major thoroughfare of the emirate – Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road (E311) in a 10-minute drive. It will take a 20 to 24-minute drive to reach Bur Dubai and Deira via E311.
Those looking for public transportation near Dubai Digital Park will have to drive for around 7-minutes to reach the DSO Operation Centre bus station. Other stations nearby include Silicon Oasis Headquarters bus station and Silicon Oasis Lagoon bus station. If you plan to visit the central emirate, opt for a metro service available within a 16 to 20-minute drive. The nearest metro stations include Rashidiya Metro Station and Etisalat Metro Station.
AMENITIES, SCHOOLS AND HEALTHCARE
SUPERMARKETS IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Residents can buy daily essentials from Carrefour Market in the community
Carrefour Market in Dubai Digital Park offers fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy products, deli items and other daily essentials. Residents can also find some of the best supermarkets in Dubai Silicon Oasis, a short drive away from the community. These include West Zone Supermarket, Choithrams and Good Market.
CHURCHES, TEMPLES AND MOSQUES NEAR DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Shaikha Ali Mosque can accommodate up to 650 worshippers
There are plenty of mosques near Dubai Digital Park where Muslim residents can offer their daily and congregational prayers. Shaikha Ali Mosque, Al Waha Masjid and Shamsa Mohammad Al Huraiz Masjid are a few of them. All these mosques are accessible within a 5 to 10-minute drive.
Most of the best churches in Dubai are concentrated in Oud Metha, located a 20-minute drive away from the community. Christians can visit St. Mary’s Catholic Church, New Covenant Church and the Dubai City Church for worship. Those who follow Hinduism can drive for around 25 minutes towards the north-western side of Dubai to visit the Bur Dubai temples.
SCHOOLS NEAR DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Parents with toddlers and school-going children will find plenty of reputable education institutes near the community. Toddlers International Nursery is one of the best nursery schools in Dubai Silicon Oasis, following the British Early Years Foundation Stage curriculum (EYFS). Other nursery schools near the community are Emirates British Nursery Silicon Oasis and British Orchard Nursery.
Indian International School is located near the neighbourhood
Those who are at an early age can go to GEMS Wellington Academy Dubai Silicon Oasis. It is a part of the GEMS Education group and follows the British Curriculum for Foundation Stage 1 to Year 13 students. Other schools near Dubai Digital Park include Indian International School DSO and Vernus International School.
Those seeking higher education institutes can find plenty of reputable internationally accredited options nearby since the community is located close to Academic City. It is home to some of the best universities in Dubai, including the University of Dubai, Zayed University Dubai and Amity University. Students can reach any of the universities near Dubai Digital Park in less than a 15-minute drive.
clinics-and-hospitals-near: Fakeeh University Hospital is one of the premium healthcare facilities offering cardiac diseases, diabetes and endocrinology, emergency medicine and pulmonary medicine. It also has a laboratory and pharmacy along with a well-equipped intensive care unit. The hospital is located a 6-minute drive from the community. Other clinics near Digital Park Silicon Oasis are Health Hub Silicon Oasis and Medi Family Poly Clinic.

Other nearby areas include Ras Al Khor and Al Rashidiya Dubai.

Some of the popular outlets include Mothercare, Claire’s, Grand Optics and Nanjee Parshotam Jewellers. It is also home to Carrefour and casual eateries such as Subway, McDonald’s, Pizza Hut and Starbucks. Other shopping malls nearby are Dubai Outlet Mall and Cityland Mall.
RESTAURANTS IN DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
Restaurant in Dubai Digital Park
There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in Dubai Digital Park offering a variety of cuisines. These include Grand Beirut, Kana Lounge and One Byte Café. The business hotel in the community also has several dining options such as RED Roof, OUIBAR + Terrace and Cali-Poke. Residents can also dine at some of the best restaurants in Dubai Silicon Oasis, accessible within a 5 to 10-minute drive.
Those looking for an Indian restaurant can head to My Home Kitchen while The Monk on the ground level of SIT Tower serves flavourful Asian dishes. Other restaurants nearby include Kulcha King, Little Bangkok and the Spice Trail.
beaches-near:
The Beach JBR is a popular picnic spot in the city
If you plan a corporate picnic or a fun day with your office colleagues under the sun on the sandy beaches, The Beach JBR must be on your priority list. The Insta-worthy location offers plenty of watersport activities, delicious eateries, a beachside mall and other activities for beach-goers. Kite Beach is one of the popular beaches in Dubai, an idyllic spot for kitesurfing. The beach also has a library, fitness centre and a jogging track. Both the beaches near Digital Park Silicon Oasis are accessible in less than 30 minutes.
leisure-activities-and-notable-landmarks:
A few notable landmarks near the district are:
Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary
IMG Worlds of Adventure
Global Village
Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary is an expansive wetland where tens of thousands of birds come into sight. Listed among the best natural places in Dubai, the sanctuary protects numerous species of flora and fauna. Visitors can spot flamingos, grey herons, sandpipers, cormorants and other migratory and resident birds at the sanctuary. It also features mangroves, lagoons and salt flats, making it a perfect habitat for nesting. The natural site is protected and monitored by Dubai Municipality.
IMG World of Adventure is the largest indoor theme park in the region
IMG Worlds of Adventure is a popular indoor leisure attraction for adventure seekers accessible within a 15-minute drive. It is the largest indoor theme park in the world and features a plethora of thrilling rides. Visitors can also watch their favourite blockbusters at the 12-screen Novo Cinemas and enjoy eating from restaurants and cafes in the theme park.
Global Village is a seasonal attraction featuring themed pavilions from all over the world. It is open during the winter months of Dubai, generally from November to April. Dubai Miracle Garden and the Track Meydan Golf are other nearby tourist attractions located 20 – 30 minutes away from Dubai Digital Park.
outdoor-activities,-fitness-and-beauty:
Visiting the DSO Lake Park is one of the best things to do in Dubai Silicon Oasis. It is the nearest recreational facility to unwind while jogging or strolling by the lake. Silicon Park and Central Park are other options for fitness enthusiasts featuring an array of amenities, including a well-paved running track and football and volleyball courts. It will take a 4 to 8-minute drive to reach any of these parks near Digital Park Silicon Oasis.
Although the community has fitness centres equipped with modern amenities and facilities, some of the best gyms in Dubai Silicon Oasis are also accessible within a short drive. These include MAX Gym in IT Plaza and Nitro Gym in the Apricot Towers.
Beauty Avenue Salon & Spa is one of the best salons in Dubai Silicon Oasis, offering premium services for hair and manicures. It is located a 6-minute drive away from the community in Le Solarium Tower. Other salons and spas near Dubai Digital Park are Refinery Beauty Lounge and Mash Gents Saloon.
community-events:
The Conference Centre in Dubai Digital Park
The Conference Centre in Digital Park Silicon Oasis has three auditoriums and state-of-the-art meeting rooms for corporate events. Moreover, the central square in the community has been specially designed to host live events, product launches and fashion shows. It has 5,000 sq. m. of open space with a capacity to accommodate 4,400 people alongside ample parking spaces.
things-to-consider:
Dubai Digital Park is supported by smart public amenities and facilities to cater to people’s high quality of life and work. Although it is a self-sufficient community with plenty of recreational facilities, the only downside is the limited public transportation. Those relying on public transportation will have to drive for 7 to 15-minutes to reach the nearest bus or metro station. It is an ideal community for those with their own private cars.
FAQS ABOUT DUBAI DIGITAL PARK
WHERE IS DUBAI DIGITAL PARK LOCATED?
Dubai Digital Park, formerly known as Silicon Park, is a mixed-use development located in the heart of Dubai Silicon Oasis.
HOW MANY SMART SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE AT DUBAI DIGITAL PARK?
Digital Park Silicon Oasis is a smart city in Dubai featuring around 60 smart services worth more than AED 100 million.
IS DUBAI DIGITAL PARK A FREEHOLD AREA?
Digital Park is a part of Dubai Silicon Oasis, which is a government-owned free zone area. This means it is a designated business zone that exempts the companies operating there from taxation. Investors interested in buying freehold properties can take a look at freehold areas in Dubai.
